poem:
Title: The Metamorphosis of a Songbird

Unfamiliar, this newfound serenity,
In the heart's quietude, a voice hums.
A Southern bird, shedding fancied liberty,
Outgrows the once-promised, smoky crumbs.

Her melodies beguile, with grown grace,
In notes, freed from the jade's haze.
The Deeper Well of her emerald space,
Echoes a brighter, more clarified phrase.

An honest lyric, in a pared-back tune,
Reveals a Songbird, in her ripened noon.
